4 Asya Harris

Bio

Stats

Historical

Biography

2020-21: No competition due to COVID19...named to the SSC Fall Commissioner's Honor Roll

2019 (Sophomore): Appeared in all 31 matches... Led the team's attack with 377 kills for an average of 3.28 per set...Recorded double-digit in kills in 21 matches... Had a career-high 24 kills at Nova Southeastern on November 16 while hitting .289 percent, also recorded four blocks in the match... Reached 22 kills in a match twice this season in five sets against Barry (Oct. 26) and in four sets against Saint Leo (Nov. 5)... Hit .524 percent against Converse (Sept. 14), recording 12 kills and only one error... Recorded a double-double against Tiffin (Ohio) on Sept. 6 with 17 kills and 10 digs...Named to SSC Fall Commissioner's Honor Roll

2018 (Freshman): Played in 23 matches in her first season...Emerged as a powerful-hitting threat on the left side averaging 3.14 kills per set, second-best on the team...Totaled 207 kills...Recorded 20 kills in a five-set loss to Saint Leo on September 7...Set a new season-high with 21 kills against Lynn on September 21...Reached double-digits in kills in 11 matches...Had 17 blocks on the season...Named to SSC Fall Commissioner's Honor Roll.

Prior to Eckerd: Prepped at Grain Valley High School in Kansas City, Missouri, where she was a first-team all-conference, all-district and all-region selection while also earning academic all-district honors...During her senior season, she averaged 3.07 kills per set while hitting .257 from the outside.

Personal: Daughter of Fredrick Harris and Regina Galichia...Hobbies include kick boxing, yoga, and attending sporting events...Favorite athlete is Serena Williams

HONORS/AWARDS

SSC Fall Commissioner's Honor Roll (2018. 2019, 2020)
